meanings.definition: To bring shame or dishonor upon
meanings.sent1: He disgraced himself by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The politician was disgraced after being caught in a corruption scandal.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy disgraced itself by chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her actions disgraced her family name beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's work disgraced the historic building.

meanings.sent1: The team was disgraced by their poor sportsmanship.
meanings.sent2: She felt disgraced when her lies were exposed.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter disgraced himself by spilling drinks on the guests.
meanings.sent4: The once-respected professor was disgraced by his involvement in a scandal.
meanings.sent5: The company's unethical practices disgraced its reputation in the industry.

meanings.definition: A person who has fallen from grace or honor
meanings.sent1: The disgraced CEO resigned amidst the embezzlement scandal.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a disgraced member of the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The disgraced athlete struggled to rebuild his career after the doping scandal.
meanings.sent4: The disgraced former mayor now lives in seclusion.
meanings.sent5: The disgraced actor's comeback was met with skepticism from the public.
